ciVFpeTe.question: When selected to normal, the oxygen/air ratio of the mixture supplied by the cockpit oxygen system regulator..

options.text: increases when the altitude increases.
decreases when the altitude increases.
is constant whatever the altitude.

w4pA541a.question:
The disadvantages of a chemical oxygen source for the passenger cabin are:
1) a flow which cannot be modulated.
2) a heavy and bulky system.
3) non-reversible functioning.
4) risks of explosion.
5) poor autonomy.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

cLlT44kb.question: A pressurised aeroplane is flying at FL 370 and experiences a rapid decompression.  Which of the following statements about the oxygen system is correct?

options.text: After an automatic mask presentation for cabin crew and passengers, oxygen starts to flow only after the mask has been firmly pulled.
The oxygen masks are automatically presented to flight crew members.
If the automatic mask presentation has been activated, the oxygen flow will start immediately.
In general manual override of the automatic presentation of passenger oxygen masks is not possible.

s2ZuVoM6.question:
The installation and use of on-board oxygen generators is such that:
1) the smoking ban is imperative when used.
2) in case of accidental drop of the "continuous flow" passenger masks, no crew action is required.
3) no trace of grease must be found in the system assembly.
4) the system's filling adaptors must be greased with non-freezable or graphite grease.
The combination which regroups all of the correct statements is:

sQE1XllG.question: Which of these statements about the oxygen system in transport aeroplanes is correct?

options.text: If the automatic passenger mask presentation fails, it is possible to retrieve an individual mask by opening the mask storage compartment with a sharp pointed object.
A chemical oxygen generator can be switched off.
Chemical oxygen generators are used in the cockpit to supply the flight crew because of the low weight of this system.
It is not possible to visually verify when the oxygen flows to a passenger mask.

hKzEjI5s.question: Which of these statements about the oxygen system in transport aeroplanes is incorrect?

options.text: Passengers must leave the toilet(s) immediately after a decompression because oxygen systems are not installed in toilets.
It is possible to visually verify when the oxygen flows to a passenger mask.
A chemical oxygen generator cannot be switched off.
The chemical oxygen generator incorporates a heat shield.

nl2NOOwt.question: When the air is compressed for pressurization purposes, the percentage oxygen content is

options.text: unaffected.
dependent on the degree of pressurization.
decreased.
increased.

UXp9cWwK.question:
The advantages of a chemical oxygen source for the passenger cabin are:
1) reduced weight and volume.
2) easy storage.
3) greater autonomy.
4) less risk of explosion.
5) reversible functioning.
6) no maintenance required.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:

IsLqgcpi.question: A pilot can determine the amount of oxygen in a portable bottle by observing its

options.text: pressure.
level.
temperature.
volume.

r0f3Dmz7.question:
Which of these statements about chemical oxygen generators are correct or incorrect?
 
1) Chemical oxygen generators are often used to supply passenger oxygen.
2) The oxygen supply of chemical oxygen generators, once activated, can be switched off.

options.text: 1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

pk2ROGKZ.question:
Fixed oxygen systems in pressurised aeroplanes are used to provide oxygen:
 
1. In the event of depressurisation.
2. In the event of any passenger indisposition.
3. During a normal flight.
4. In the event of smoke or toxic fumes in the cockpit.
 
The combination of correct statements is:

options.text: there is smoke in the cockpit.
the oxygen bottle is almost empty.

chemical oxygen generators are used.

CtZs2WjS.question:
Which of these statements about chemical oxygen generators are correct?
1. Chemical oxygen generators are used to supply the cockpit oxygen system.
2. The oxygen supply of chemical oxygen generators, once activated, cannot be switched off.

options.text: 1 is incorrect, 2 is correct.
Both 1 and 2 are correct.
1 is correct, 2 is incorrect.
Both 1 and 2 are incorrect.

D8RrBqHi.question: When a cabin oxygen mask is pulled downwards, the passenger breathes:

options.text: a mixture of oxygen and cabin air.
pure oxygen at the ambient pressure.
pure oxygen under pressure.

InO2H6PT.question:
The disadvantages of a chemical oxygen source compared with a gaseous one for the passenger cabin are:

1. a flow which cannot be modulated.2. less capacity.3. risk of fire and/or explosion.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:

Xe9bP8Yg.question: When quick donning masks are in use, the pilot is:

options.text: able to radiotelephone.
only able to transmit.
only able to receive.
not able to do any radio communication.

xalHP7o3.question:
Select the correct combination. In a dilute demand system:1. oxygen flow is on demand. 
 2. oxygen flow is continuous. 
 3. oxygen is mixed with cabin air 
 4. oxygen is mixed with dilute oxygen from a separate canister.

options.text: 1 and 3.
1 and 2.
2 and 4.
3 and 4.

O7YD0BZP.question: A smoke hood is a device covering:

options.text: the whole head and with a continuous oxygen flow.
the whole head and with an oxygen flow only on demand.
only the nose and the mouth and with an oxygen/air mix.
only the nose and the mouth and with a continuous oxygen flow.

u9iXsXgo.question:

1. decrease oxygen pressure from 1800 PSI (in the bottles) down to about 50-75 PSI (low pressure system)2. supply 100% oxygen3. supply diluted oxygen4. supply oxygen on demand5. supply oxygen at positive pressure6. trigger the continuous cabin altitude warning at 10000 ft cabin altitude.
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is:

HgnVVs2e.question:

- "O2" lever:	NORMAL / 100%
- EMERGENCY lever:	ON / OFF

options.text: a continuous flow mask and in principle should not be used if there is smoke in the cabin.
a continuous flow mask and must be used if there is smoke in the cabin.
an on-demand type mask and must be used if there is smoke in the cabin.
an on-demand type mask and in principle should not be used if there is smoke in the cabin.

Jqqx7dME.question: What is the purpose of first-aid portable oxygen bottles?

options.text: They are used for passengers who, for physiological reasons, might require oxygen following a cabin depressurisation.
They are only to be used in case of a sudden loss in aeroplane pressurisation, for pressurised aeroplanes operated at pressure altitudes of 10000 ft and above.
They are used by the crew in order to prevent fatigue.

f6P1iwv2.question: An unpressurized aircraft is flying at 12 000 ft. How would be the oxygen flow when required?

options.text: Diluter-demand
Unconditional
Emergency

mgSB8mTW.question: Which of these statements is correct about a flight crew oxygen mask?

options.text: Most oxygen masks can be selected into three positions: NORMAL and/or DILUTE, 100% and EMERGENCY.
In the position 'DILUTE' oxygen supply is from a special bottle containing diluted oxygen.
When selected to the position 'EMERGENCY' oxygen is supplied with some overpressure above a certain altitude.
When switched to the position 100% oxygen is always supplied with some overpressure.

YXWUXfcK.question: Which of these statements is correct about a flight crew oxygen mask?

options.text: When selected to the position EMERGENCY oxygen is always supplied with some over pressure.

In the position “DILUTE” oxygen supply is from a special bottle containing diluted oxygen.

TpDn7RGi.question: Which of these statements is correct about a flight crew oxygen mask?

When switched to the position 100%, oxygen is always supplied with some overpressure.

2yPq9CU5.question: Which of these statements is correct about a flight crew oxygen mask?

options.text: In the position “DILUTE” oxygen is mixed with air from outside the mask
When selected to the position “EMERGENCY” oxygen is supplied with some overpressure above a certain altitude.
When switched to the position 100% oxygen is always supplied with some overpressure.
Below a certain altitude the oxygen mask switches automatically to “constant flow”.

cwbsD3Sb.question:
The advantages of a chemical oxygen source compared with a gaseous one for the passenger cabin are:
1) easier maintenance.

3) reduced risk of explosion.

wH6UdopN.question: Once the oxygen masks for the passengers have dropped down, the oxygen flow starts

options.text: when each passenger pulls the oxygen mask to his/her face.
after the system has been switched on by a crew member.
only above FL200.

4GLnOc66.question: Which of these statements concerning oxygen on board passenger transport aeroplanes is correct?

options.text: Lavatories also have an oxygen drop out system to protect passengers in case of decompression.
Portable oxygen bottles are primarily intended for use in case the chemical oxygen generators fail.
A chemical oxygen generator is able to provide oxygen for at least one hour.

arPyOIWM.question: Which of these statements concerning oxygen on board of passenger transport aeroplanes is correct?

options.text: A chemical oxygen generator delivers oxygen for about 15 minutes.

After being activated a chemical oxygen generator does not produce any heat.

V0FnR54W.question: What is the name given to the mode of operation in which 100 % oxygen is inhaled on demand?

options.text: Emergency
Diluter-demand
Demand

o9gZDKbl.question: What is supplementary oxygen used for in a pressurised aircraft?
